body_html:
@mbz, it seems that you have two different GPUs active at the same time.

I tensorflow/core/common_runtime/gpu/gpu_device.cc:806] Creating TensorFlow device (/gpu:0) -> (device: 0, name: GeForce GTX 980 Ti, pci bus id: 0000:01:00.0)
I tensorflow/core/common_runtime/gpu/gpu_device.cc:806] Creating TensorFlow device (/gpu:1) -> (device: 1, name: Tesla K20c, pci bus id: 0000:02:00.0)

Could you try the following?

  1. Set the environment variable CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES=1 before running TensorFlow. It should mask off the other GPU.
  2. Your BFC log shows only about 250MB memory is allowed. Could you make sure you session config code didn't specify a smaller GPU memory limit?

Limit: 251635302
